title: 'I still wait for him to call': mother of Vietnamese suspected truck victim
text:
In her home in Vietnam, Nguyen Thi Huan still waits to hear from her son even though she is convinced he is dead.

Joseph Nguyen Dinh Luong is believed to be among the 39 people found dead in the back of a truck near London last week.

(SOUNDBITE) (Vietnamese) MOTHER OF ONE OF THE VIETNAMESE BELIEVED TO BE DEAD, JOSEPH NGUYEN DINH LUONG, NGUYEN THI HUAN, SAYING:

'I thought he went abroad to work and that he would come back home once in a while. I would have never thought… Now we are sure that he is gone but I still wait for him to call home. I still can't believe that he is dead, and have been waiting for him since that day."

The family lives in Ha Tinh, a poor province south of the capital Hanoi.

Joseph had worked as a carpenter but wanted to travel abroad to earn more money.

His father says he urged his son not to go.

British police have been trying to identify the bodies which were found in a truck container on an industrial estate near the British capital.

They say very few of the victims were carrying official identification and that they hope to identify the dead through fingerprints, dental records and DNA.

Joseph's family said they were visited by Vietnamese police on Sunday (October 27) who took hair and blood samples.
